abstract: China’s central government has begun a series of investigations this week into how much debt was incurred by local governments last year as part of economic stimulus programs undertaken in response to the global financial downturn.
snippet: China’s central government has begun a series of investigations this week into how much debt was incurred by local governments last year as part of economic stimulus programs undertaken in response to the global financial downturn.
lead_paragraph: China’s central government has begun a series of investigations this week into how much debt was incurred by local governments last year as part of economic stimulus programs undertaken in response to the global financial downturn, David Barboza and Keith Bradsher report in The New York Times.

headline.main: Chinese Auditor Issues Warning on Local Debt
